ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: coding style, philosophy, and a heritrix midfetch-filter
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Agreed. AList and strange A_.* keys should be all hidden behind clean accessors/getters.  Some of this work has been done -- e.g. the getStatusCode

Rich Collins wrote:

> Ive just started using Heretrix and it is a very feature-rich and
> powerful application.  The architecture seems well planned and usable. 
> However some of the coding style used makes it hard to develop for.  The
> use of AList may make sense from an under the hood perspective, but it
> certainly makes the API hard to use for a developer interested in
> extending is feature set.  Rather than calling CrawlURL.getStatusCode()
> I have to know that the AList has a entry for the HttpMethod (containing
> the response) and figure out which String constant is the key.  I think
> if the interface into the code was more usable to green (wrt Heretrix)
> developers, I would catch on much faster.  Not a flame just a suggestion
> (trying to help with this promising project).

Agreed. AList and strange 'A_.*' keys should be all hidden behind clean 
accessors/getters.  Some of this work has been done -- e.g. the 
getStatusCode method used to be getAList().get("A_...etc. -- but its not 
finished.
Thanks for the feedback Rich.
St.Ack

>
> Rich Collins
> Director of Information Technology
> InjuryBoard.com
> 813-225-1313 x228
> rcollins@...
>
>
>
> stackarchiveorg wrote:
>
> >
> > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> > > Dave Skinner wrote:
> > >
> > > > ....
> > > >
> > > > 1) should these variables be defined in crawlURI or be part of the
> > > > Alist or
> > > > even somewhere else?
> > >
> > > CrawlURI is the right place.  My preference would be to add the 
> data as
> > > you've done as explicit data members rather than with anonymous
> > > puts/gets into AList (We should do some refactoring so its easier
> > > plugging in different CrawlURI implementations).
> >
> > Or, perhaps its better to use the AList bucket to avoid having to make
> > modifications to CrawlURI directly (Its been clarified to me that
> > AList exists to put off the need of customizing CrawlURI).
> > Yours,
> > St.Ack
> >
> >
